value:
You use magic? That makes you
competition. At least, until we make it
clear which of us is superior.

My research in Renais was quite
rewarding, but the magic of this world
is rather fascinating as well.

Your face indicates that battle has left
you weary. I once read about an herb
that can help alleviate that.$k$pIt was on page 339 of De Floris
Mysticis. Paragraph four. Sentence
three.

Do you need something from me? My
task list currently includes 25 items
across seven categories.

Today I will review chapter five of
A Young Girl's Primer on Nazonian
Magic. From memory.$k$pAfterward, I'll head out to collect some
of the more interesting herbs that
grow in this world.

I memorized a message for you from
$Nf, thus
eliminating the need to write it down.$k$pSuch a task was child's play for a
mage and scholar without equal.

Statistically speaking, good luck
is just as likely as bad.

Surprised? Don't be. There's no
one better than me!

Statistically speaking, bad luck is
just as likely as good.

You've made a superior being
far more superior.

I'm Lute, a mage of profound genius.
If it's ultimate battle power you wished
for, consider your wish granted.

I've been examining you since the
day you summoned me here. My
daily records are impeccable.$k$pThis journal is entitled
$Nu: Daily
Observations and Habits.$k$pYou'll be impressed to find I did not
miss a single day. Please examine it.$k$p"Morning: $Nu
rose early and ate a hearty breakfast
and then trained until lunchtime.$k$p"Noon: $Nu
ate a meager lunch and then
patrolled the castle's perimeter.$k$p"Evening: $Nu
ate dinner, took a bath, and then
retired to bed without dessert."$k$pQuite insightful and thorough, as you
can see. I review this journal nightly.$k$pAt first, I thought you may be a threat
to my natural superiority, so I sought
to discover your weaknesses.$k$pBut as I continued to study you, my
motives began to change. It was quite
the odd phenomenon.$k$pFurther observations are required for
me to fully understand it, so I must
continue my daily research.$k$pPlease go about your business as
usual. I'll compile volume two of my
journal from a distance, as before.
では。
優秀ですから。
きゃああっ！
私は…まだ…
I am superior, after all.
I'll rip you to shreds with love!
You—you're dangerous.
Of course I'll win.
I don't want to die...
Heh. Heh. Heh.
I'm Lute, genius mage extraordinaire. You've probably heard of me.
My mood? On a scale of 1 to 48, I'd say I'm at a 14.
Your flesh shows no signs of putrefaction. It seems you're still alive.
You wish simply to chat? That sounds neither productive nor strategically valuable, but...
You may pose a threat to my natural superiority. This is troubling...
There is still much I need to study. My books so far have taught me nothing of love...
You and I should stick together for a while longer. After all, there's no one better than me...and you.
Yes?
You need me.
Let's begin.
